answered.question: What matters most in the conventions cleanup?
answered.answer: All of the above: Model conventions, Controller patterns, Dead code removal

answered.question: How should we handle convention violations that would change public API behavior?
answered.answer: Fix everything -- rename/restructure even if it changes method signatures or route patterns

answered.question: Favicon discovery strategy?
answered.answer: Multi-strategy cascade: /favicon.ico -> HTML parsing (full GET, Nokogiri, prefer largest) -> Google Favicon API. Skip DuckDuckGo.

answered.question: How to handle downloaded favicons before storage?
answered.answer: Store raw original via Active Storage, define two variants: 32x32 (standard) and 64x64 (retina). SVGs stored as-is AND rasterized to PNG.

answered.question: Favicon refresh and failure policy?
answered.answer: Piggyback on successful feed fetches (if missing, enqueue job). Cooldown-then-retry on failure, configurable retry_cooldown_days defaulting to 7.

answered.question: Active Storage requirement for favicons?
answered.answer: Required (no URL-only fallback). Guard with if defined?(ActiveStorage) on model and job. No AS = no favicons, no errors.

answered.question: Reference implementation for favicon extraction?
answered.answer: Adapt AlexMili/extract_favicon (Python) to Ruby. Key patterns: link/meta tag parsing, fallback paths, ICO header parsing, size preference.

answered.question: How should stacked toast overflow expand?
answered.answer: Click/tap the +N more badge to toggle. No hover. Slide-down animation (~200ms). Click again or outside to collapse.

answered.question: Toast priority when capped at 3?
answered.answer: Newest 3 shown (FIFO). Errors get longer auto-dismiss (10s vs 5s) so they naturally persist. No slot reservation.

answered.question: Dismiss behavior with hidden overflow toasts?
answered.answer: Promote next hidden toast into view. +N more count decrements. Clear all link when overflow exists.

answered.question: Toast capping architecture: client-only or server-aware?
answered.answer: Client-only. New Stimulus controller wraps #source_monitor_notifications. Server keeps appending unchanged. Zero backend changes.

inferred: User wants comprehensive cleanup, not surface-level
Public API changes are acceptable for convention alignment
Tests should be updated to match any changes, not removed
All layers: models, controllers, services, dead code
Generator should be maximally helpful -- create files rather than just warn
Target Rails 8 defaults (queue.yml) rather than supporting legacy naming
Favicon feature uses ImageProcessing gem with vips backend for variants
FaviconFetchJob needs last_favicon_attempt_at tracking on Source model
Content type validation and max file size cap for favicon downloads
